main event: On April 3rd, 1949, a report was made regarding an explosion near Rodeo, New Mexico, which was initially thought to involve a downed aircraft.
interesting points: Witnesses described a huge crater resulting from the explosion., A piece of metal approximately 12 inches in diameter was found at the site., The investigation suggested the explosion was caused by a practice bomb., Multiple letters from military officials discuss the incident and follow-up actions., The site is remote, about ten miles east of Rodeo, New Mexico.
sighted object: explosion site and a piece of metal
witness description: Mr. ------------ and Mr. ------------ (names redacted), who were patrolmen and riders.
